sub_title: Senior software developer with Interaction Design background. WordPress expert since 1.5. Linux & Open Source enthusiast
summary:
Hi!  
Please contact me via https://burobjorn.nl or if you'd like to connect via LinkedIn please introduce yourself. Default LinkedIn messages without any personal touch or context will be ignored due to the amount of LinkedIn spam I receive/

All-round creative software developer with a background in interaction design, online media and (web)development.  WordPress expert since version 1.5. 

Linux enthusiast. Advocate for free open source software, open standards, open content, digitale civil liberties, free culture and user innovation.

Specializes in realizing ideas, wishes, plans and requirements using free, open source software, open standards and open content. 

Technologist and design aficionado. Experienced speaker. Quick learner & team player. Gets the job done. Clear & direct communicator. 

Experienced in using online tools for collaboration with companies and individuals in- as well as outside the Netherlands. Fluent in English and Dutch. Proficient in German Located in the Netherlands. Self-employed under the moniker Burobjorn and available for hire.

Specialties: 
Software development, interaction design, concept development, writing, presenting, online media, open content, free open-source software, open standards, copyright, civil liberties, music, Creative Commons, Linux, WordPress, WordPress MU, WordPress Network, Multisite, PHP, (X)HTML, HTML5, CSS, Javascript, (My)SQL, Subversion, Bazaar, Ansible, Vagrant, DevOps, Git etc.

profile_positions.description:
Elected position to represent members of the Dutch Unix User Group association. 

The purpose of the association is:
- To represent the interests of users of Open Standards-based software and Open systems.
- To disseminate (among members) knowledge about Open Standards and the software and infrastructure using them.
- Spreading knowledge among members about the operation of Open systems.
- Stimulating the application of Open standards and Open systems in the professional environment of companies, organisations, government and education, among others.
- Improving the contacts between professional users and the companies dealing with systems based on the UNIX tradition of Open systems, both nationally and internationally. 

It seeks to achieve this goal by, inter alia:
- Organising independent technical conferences for members on a regular basis, where suppliers and affiliated groups can also present.
- Stimulating, initiating and organising theme meetings and other meetings.
- Distributing software and documentation, insofar as it is able and entitled to do so.
- Liaising with other national and international organisations with similar objectives.
- Establishing and maintaining contacts with suppliers of hardware, software, knowledge and/or know-how deemed to be of interest to its members.
profile_positions.title: NLUUG boardmember

profile_positions.description: Elected position to represent Creative Commons in The Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Creative Commons The Netherlands chapter lead

profile_positions.description: Open Nederland is an association for everyone who works with or promotes open licenses or open license material.
profile_positions.title: Board member Open Nederland

profile_positions.description:
Burobjorn specializes in realizing ideas and wishes with the use of free, open source software, open standards and open content. Expert in custom (complex) WordPress projects.

Activities range from advice, concept developing to rapid-prototyping and final implementations. Mainly online media such as websites and webapplications. 
 
Burobjorn is available for hire and experienced in collaborating using online tools with companies and people in- and outside the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: BEEA (Builders, Engineers, Explorers & Artists previously Hackersnl) is a monthly returning event in Utrecht, The Netherlands bringing together hackers, engineers, builders, makers, artists & all those interested in technology and it's impact on society. The event usually consists of three parts: a short 'ice-breaker' introduction round to get an impression of the people present, a 30 to 45 min thorough technical presentation on a topic such as a programming language (Haskell, Scala, Lua etc) or hardware like Jeenode, LAOS (Laser Open Source) followed by a 30 to 45 min presentation of technology in a broader context like the Quantified Self movement, Open Source development practices and having fun with the Arduino Lillypad. After the presentations there's always plenty of room for some informal discussions & having a drink with eachother.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
The goal of the Open Media Foundation (Stichting Open Media) was to encourage creativity within the different types of current and future media forms and the sharing of knowledge. 

We were focussed on Simuze -- an online music platform to legally share music and exchange music, using Creative Commons licenses, between artists and fans.   

As co-founder and member of the board I was mainly occupied with the long-term strategy and vision. Together with my fellow board members I also dealt with the daily practice such as maintenance and future development of Simuze.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
As an external supervisor connected to the Utrecht School of the Arts. I supervise and coach students in realizing real world projects.

Students are gently introduced into working on projects with real clients and this allows them to (mostly for the first time) experience what working on a real project with a real client means.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
I've fulfilled several roles during the time I worked at Waag society: 

Initially I started out as a backend-developer. In this position I was responsible for the development of php based backend systems.  After some time my role changed into frontend-developer.   

As a frontend-developer I've built interfaces for both physical installations and (web)applications using Flash, Javascript (X)HTML and CSS. My background in interaction design was very helpful in this role.

Finally I changed from position again and became the assistant of the director of Public Research  -- a small part of Waag Society which was focussed on technology and it's impact om society. In this role I was mostly involved with advocating Creative Commons licenses and setting up Creative Commons Netherlands. 

My activities focussed on promoting Creative Commons and the ideas behind it by writing  articles, organizing meetings, giving presentations, producing a cd/dvd, developing and maintaining (both technically as well as content) the Creative Commons Netherlands website.
profile_positions.title: Backend-developer / Frontend-developer / Assistent of Public Research
